description_sections.heading: Track
description_sections.content: Education

description_sections.heading: Inspiration
description_sections.content:
I'm lazy. You read that right. Very lazy. I want things done fast, easy, quick. I was in bed, reading an online textbook, in a position where my hands didn't feel like touching the keyboard. Few minutes into my automata and complexity textbook, I had no clue what I was reading (maybe I should skip class less often). I knew the next best way to learn the concept was to watch a video.

BUT HOW!?

I'm nicely comfortable in a position I don't want to change to go on YouTube.

WHAT DO I DO!?

Ended up making EdZy at Hack Princeton as a solution to make my job easier.

description_sections.heading: What it does
description_sections.content: It helps you find the answer to your topic/question instantly in the format of a video. It lands you in the exact timestamp matching the answer to your query using sophisticated algorithms. You can use Command + E (for Mac ONLY) and Ctrl + Q (for other devices) after highlighting the text you want to search to use the extension. Get results in 1-2 seconds.

description_sections.heading: How I built it
description_sections.content: The frontend of the app was built using a chrome extension framework and APIs, as well as fundamental languages like HTML, CSS, JS, and Bootstrap. The server was hosted on an Azure T4 GPU, pros to being backed by Microsoft for Startups, and was used to run high inference implementation code. Prior to code base migration, the code was unit tested on a NVIDIA RTX laptop, provided by MLH. The algorithm utilizes parallelism in the pipeline to process multiple tasks at the same time. YouTube's search and transcript APIs are used to fetch the necessary data contents necessary. All-MiniLM-L6-v2 embeddings from HuggingsFace are used to extract chunks across the data. A novel algorithm is in place using turing machines, recursive divide and conquer sub-algorithms, and other inputs to extract answers based on queries.

description_sections.heading: Challenges I ran into
description_sections.content: One challenge I ran into was getting access to an Azure T4 GPU. The GPU market is terrible and this one was hard to pull off after a lengthy email conversation and ticket. Another challenge was reducing the latency. When I started building this algorithm, it took nearly 30 seconds. Now it gets the job done in 1-2 seconds. This is all thanks to all the optimizations in place, from converting the model to ONNX files to using optimal data structures. Another challenge was limited time for testing. So I got my friends to test the product I made and give user feedback on areas where it failed. Based on feedback I received, for example limited context, I was able to expand on ideas; for example, the chrome extension takes more content than what you highlight under some scenarios (based on another semantic comparison algorithm) in order to produce more accurate results. One last challenge I faced, in addition to other multiple minor ones, was integrating the extension with OpenAI. Web scraping was a lengthy task and involved a lot of testing, rather than just writing code in one-go and compiling it in one-go, which took a lot of time, but the end product was really useful based on the feedback I received.

description_sections.heading: Accomplishments that I'm proud of
description_sections.content: Having a 1-2 second latency to provide very accurate results is simply fascinating to me. Also, I'm not much of a video creator guy myself, and making the video on Canva was a fun experience and I loved the output video I made. Definitely one of my biggest accomplishments in this hackathon so far.

description_sections.heading: What I learned
description_sections.content: How to optimize models using ONNX so save 2x runtime Implementing job queue on the server for requests Chrome Extension APIs in depth Implementing and evaluating models like TransDETR and other data extraction models How to make videos on Canva

description_sections.heading: What's next for EdZy
description_sections.content: Turns out, everyones likes it (or maybe they are being nice about it). Anyways, look forward to a production version, around two weeks, once beta-testing and iteration over user feedback is over next week :) Also after talking with a few startup business owners, realized potential for a B2B solution using the algorithm I built in this.

description_sections.content: bootstrap canva chromeextension css github html huggingsface javascript microsoftazure python rag textvisionmodel vectorembeddings youtubesearchapi youtubetranscriptapi

description_sections.content: github.com www.edzy.tech

description_sections.content: At Interview Wizard, our mission is to empower job and internship candidates with the skills and confidence they need to succeed in interviews. We provide a personalized and comprehensive platform that tailors interview practice to the specific roles candidates apply for. By offering sophisticated grading and analysis of interview answers, we aim to cultivate a community of skilled professionals ready to excel in their careers.

description_sections.heading: What it does
description_sections.content: Interview Wizard is a web application that makes interview training for candidates applying for jobs & internships easier by tailoring interview practice to the roles they apply to and also grading and analysing their interview answers!

description_sections.heading: How we built it
description_sections.content: Built with FrontEnd: HTML, CSS BackEnd: MongoDB, Modal, OpenAI API, Django

description_sections.heading: Challenges we ran into
description_sections.content: We had troubles with integrating the machine learning model taking in the video to respon into the flow of events.

description_sections.heading: Accomplishments that we're proud of
description_sections.content: We built a website in 36 hours with tools we learned during that time.

winners.tagline: Maximizing Job Application Success By Customizing Resumes For Each Job With An Automatic Tailor.

prizes.prize_name: Best Use of AI for the Interview Process by Simplify Interviews

description_sections.heading: Inspiration üí°
description_sections.content: I'm sure all of you have also experienced the pain of trying to apply to hundreds of job postings only to hear back 4 months later that the position you applied to has already been filled. Well, we were sick of it!

description_sections.heading: What It Does ‚öôÔ∏è
description_sections.content: Resume ArchiTech is a custom resume tailor that will help maximize your chances of success by hand-picking your projects and work experience for each job you apply to. A task that would normally take 10-20 minutes can now be done in seconds, maximizing the quantity and quality of your job applications.

description_sections.heading: How We Build It üõ†Ô∏è
description_sections.content: Resume ArchiTech is an amalgamation of various cutting-edge technologies to make the tasks of resume tailoring for jobs possible. We run a Flask backend with a MongoDB database along with a React front end, hosted on Render.com. To automatically tailor your resume for every job application we use a combination of GitHub API scraping to automatically gather information about your proudest projects, OpenAIs GPT3.5-turbo to generate resume bullet points for all of your projects, a HuggingFace Semantic Search Model to match the most relevant projects and experiences to a job posting, and python DOCX to automatically generate a ready to go PDF and Word document that you can apply with right away!

description_sections.heading: Challenges We Ran Into üß±
description_sections.content:
UI: One challenge we ran into was integrating all of the different parts of our app. We built up different parts of our App concurrently and integrating all of this in the front end was a big user experience challenge.

Optimization: Using so many different APIs and AI models at times created a lot of delay when tailoring a users experiences to a given job. We managed to work around this by implementing asynchronous requests to different APIs, for instance using asyncio to send all of our OpenAI calls simultaneously so that users with many projects wouldn't have to wait too long to generate their resume bullet points. We also heavily optimized our scraping of users' GitHubs, by avoiding doing manual scraping and leveraging the GitHub API, which provides a lot of convenient data about user projects.

description_sections.heading: Accomplishments that we're proud of üéì
description_sections.content: We believe our final webapp provides a very smooth and polished experience for the user to generate their custom-tailored resume which we are very proud of. This was our first time building an application using the OpenAI API, or Flask, and was a huge learning experience for using all of the different technologies that went into making this project a reality. We are extremely proud of how much we've learned while building ArchiTech and are excited to use these technologies in future projects!

description_sections.heading: What's next for Resume ArchiTech üöÄ
description_sections.content:
We want to continue developing bullet-point generation by using larger models trained on shorter sentences. We also want to improve our prompt engineering to more effectively implement the STAR (Situation, Task, Approach, Result) method for bullet-point generation.

Furthermore, we want to figure out our parallelization for semantic embeddings such that a user will be able to apply to more jobs quickly.

winners.tagline: Improving firefighter performance saves lives. That‚Äôs why using Immersive VR performance reviews lets firefighters enter reconstructed rooms during fire response, letting them evaluate performance.

prizes.prize_name: Best Use of MATLAB Prize by MathWorks

description_sections.heading: Inspiration
description_sections.content:
About 350,000 house fires happen in the US each year. One teammate recently had a house fire, and thanks to the quick response from the fire department, many parts of the house were salvaged. In lieu of this recent event, we wondered how to help support the fire department through the use of technology to save others from the same experience. By allowing them to review their performance in a more immersive manner to prevent people like our teammate from going through such events.

After speaking with our friend who works as a firefighter near our college‚Äôs campus, as well as extensive background research, we found out that the current system for performance reviews relies on personal experience and video footage. In order to enhance these reviews, we decided to use 3D modeling and virtual reality to transform the process. The lossy act of remembering one‚Äôs decisions in a life-or-death moment can then be replaced by interactive 3D reconstructions of mission history. So, an immersive replay of the fire response can thus prove to improve performance and save more lives in the future.

description_sections.heading: What it does
description_sections.content:
Our solution uses VR technology to create an immersive replay of the fire response. The reviewer puts on the headset and sees an information rich graph, alerting them to key moments in the fire response (special points of interest). Then they select these points in time and are teleported to the actions of the firefighters during this time. The firefighter's exact actions are captures using 3D reconstruction technology.

Using monocular video data (single camera, like a firefighter helmet cam) we generated a point cloud using SLAM technology and then a 3D mesh through point meshing algorithm to detail the environment the fighter went through. We then implemented a graph on the user‚Äôs sidebar to examine the room‚Äôs temperature change, modeled from a realistic dataset created by simulation, over the fire‚Äôs duration. This is used to identify points of interest through the fire. Additionally, we simulated room temperature data spatially using a meshed plot. Our 3D model depicts how the temperature of a room could be displayed for a user to examine specific areas of the room that had high temperature peaks, and this used to identify areas of interest within the room for training exercises and performance reviews.

description_sections.heading: How we built it
description_sections.content: Used Unity3D VR, MATLAB, Colmap

description_sections.heading: Challenges we ran into
description_sections.content: In MATLAB, we had to overcome one technical challenge of exporting a 3D graph with interactive features in order to make a meaningful connection with the VR technology. We were able to make this important connection by creating a pipeline to convert the simulation to an interactive file that could be implemented in VR. This was very important for making the system efficient and user friendly.

description_sections.heading: Accomplishments that we're proud of
description_sections.content: Figured out intricacies of Unity VR, found out how 3D room reconstruction works, getting seasoned with MATLAB

description_sections.heading: What we learned
description_sections.content:
Learned 3D room reconstruction, deepened VR skills, learned MATLAB (!!!!)

Both members of our team learned more about areas of technology we were relatively unfamiliar with, including 3D plotting/mapping with MATLAB and generating direct SLAM point clouds. Generating the mapped environments involved learning about the computer vision ecosystem, especially when it comes to depth mapping and meshing together point clouds. We looked through many different pipelines, including OpenSLAM, multiSLAM, and more before finally settling on Colmaps.

In addition, while our team was familiar with using Unity, we were new to integrating it with VR. Once the initial environment setup was done, figuring out how to code interactions pushed our understanding of VR. We developed new knowledge about the usages of VR in healthcare. An interesting avenue of education was choosing between various interaction technique (OpenXR vs OVR) and evaluating which was best for our hack.

description_sections.heading: What's next for Firefighter SLAM
description_sections.content: Open source this project Addition of complete pipeline for multi-video to 3D mesh creation under the hood of a Unity-based app Adding more data streaming features into app 3D temperature visualizations Improve interaction methods with the data Features to Pause, Play, Rewind operations

description_sections.heading: Built With
description_sections.content: ar c# colmap matlab unity vr

description_sections.content: github.com

description_sections.heading: FarmShield: A Paradigm Shift in Agricultural Insurance and Crop Protection
description_sections.content:
Introduction

In the complex landscape of agricultural insurance, the process for farmers to secure appropriate coverage has been notoriously challenging. Predicated on the intricate interplay of government regulations and insurance company policies, the accessibility of fair insurance premiums has remained elusive. FarmShield emerged as a response to these challenges, with a vision to streamline and enhance the accessibility of farm insurance through technological innovation.

Development Insight

Our journey commenced with an in-depth analysis of the existing insurance framework, which revealed a significant reliance on USDA decisions, leading to minimal flexibility in premium adjustments by insurance providers. This insight laid the foundational premise for FarmShield: to introduce a custom safety score, enabling reductions in insurance rates by 5-30% through advanced satellite imagery analysis.

Data Acquisition and Analysis

The cornerstone of our approach involved meticulous data mining efforts, leveraging both public and proprietary datasets. Utilizing SAS software, we conducted rigorous regression analysis to unearth patterns and correlations between farm practices, environmental factors, and crop yield outcomes. This empirical analysis facilitated the creation of synthetic datasets, simulating potential insurance discounts grounded in quantifiable risk assessments.

Satellite Imagery Utilization

A pivotal aspect of FarmShield's innovation lies in the utilization of satellite imagery. By harnessing this technology, we generated detailed visual data maps of agricultural land, enabling the precision assessment of crop health, soil moisture levels, and other critical agronomic factors. This comprehensive analysis underpins our safety score algorithm, offering a nuanced risk evaluation mechanism that transcends traditional insurance assessment models.

Machine Learning for Crop Protection

Parallel to our insurance innovation, we developed a machine learning model designed to diagnose plant health issues. This model was trained using an extensive dataset comprising images of healthy and diseased crops, encompassing a broad spectrum of agricultural diseases. Through advanced image recognition techniques, the model provides instantaneous diagnostic insights, empowering farmers with actionable information to safeguard their crops against potential threats.

Challenges and Solutions

The endeavor to meld complex datasets, advanced analytics, and machine learning into a cohesive platform was fraught with challenges. Data normalization, ensuring model accuracy across diverse crop types, and the integration of disparate data sources required a multifaceted approach. Our solution was iterative refinement: continuous model training, validation, and adjustment, guided by both quantitative data and qualitative feedback from early adopters.

Professional Engagement

FarmShield represents a collaborative effort between technology experts and the agricultural community. As a team of two, our roles spanned the gamut of data science, software development, and stakeholder engagement. This project is not merely a testament to technological innovation but a reflection of our commitment to enhancing the resilience and productivity of the farming sector.

Conclusion

FarmShield stands at the confluence of agriculture and technology, embodying a forward-thinking approach to farm insurance and crop protection. Through diligent data analysis, innovative application of satellite imagery, and the development of a predictive machine learning model, we have laid the groundwork for a more equitable and informed agricultural insurance landscape. As we advance, we remain dedicated to refining our methodologies, expanding our dataset, and continuously improving the utility and accuracy of FarmShield for the agricultural community.

winners.tagline: Medicognize: AI-Powered Healthcare, Speedy Diagnostics, Global Specialist Access, and Multilingual Patient Support

prizes.prize_name: Best Use of AI & Verbwire API

description_sections.heading: Inspiration
description_sections.content: Accessing quality specialist doctors is often hindered by long wait times, different appointment dates, and geographical barriers, making it difficult for people worldwide to receive the best healthcare possible. MediCognize aims to bridge these gaps, ensuring accessible, quality healthcare for everyone, regardless of location. Additionally, we address the crucial issue of health data privacy and security by leveraging blockchain technology to maintain the integrity of patient data.

description_sections.heading: What It Does
description_sections.content:
MediCognize offers a platform where doctors and patients connect via video conference, enhanced by AI to bridge the physical gap. This system is backed by Verbwire API and MagicPilot.ai, ensuring a secure environment through IPFS and blockchain wallet verifications for data access. Our AI analyzes patient data, briefing doctors efficiently. Our video conference tool, powered by Azure, provides session summaries and task scheduling for ongoing care. For minor physical issues, patients can upload photos for AI-driven diagnostics. Furthermore, our platform supports doctors with an AI assistant for instant access to patient details, utilizing StarkNet technology for secure blockchain contracts and Auth0 for robust authentication.

How We Used Verbwire API, MagicPilot.ai, Auth0, and StarkNet

Verbwire API and MagicPilot.ai : Essential for secure medical data transmission, enabling encrypted information sharing between healthcare providers and our platform, ensuring privacy and security compliance. As an AI platform specializing in building applications, MagicPilot.ai was instrumental in automating and optimizing the development of patient-centric features on our platform. Auth0 : User Authentication: Implemented streamlined authentication processes, including secure login mechanisms for a safe user experience. Multifactor Authentication: Added an extra security layer through multifactor authentication, ensuring users are verified through multiple verification methods. StarkNet : Blockchain Contracts: Developed smart contracts for secure and transparent transactions and data access. Data Security: Ensured immutable record-keeping and secure, decentralized access to medical records.

description_sections.heading: Challenges We Ran Into
description_sections.content: Training our neural network for the AI diagnostic tool involved significant challenges, particularly in gathering diverse datasets for accurate diagnostics. Implementing our video service and integrating Verbwire, StarkNet, and Auth0 presented steep learning curves due to their complex requirements for secure data handling and user authentication.

description_sections.heading: Accomplishments That We're Proud Of
description_sections.content: We are proud to have developed a platform that not only facilitates basic to semi-advanced medical needs globally but also incorporates cutting-edge technology to ensure the best possible user experience. Our platform stands out by offering inclusive services that cater to a global audience, transcending language and geographical barriers.

description_sections.heading: What We Learned
description_sections.content:
The development process was a profound learning experience in several key areas:

Blockchain Application in Healthcare : We gained insights into the complexities of implementing blockchain for secure and private health data storage. AI in Medical Diagnostics : We explored the challenges and potential of AI for accurate and timely healthcare diagnostics. Telemedicine Enhancements : We learned about the integration of video conferencing and AI assistance to improve patient care and doctor efficiency.

description_sections.heading: What's Next for MediCognize
description_sections.content:
Our next steps include enhancing the platform's AI capabilities and expanding our services to support doctors and patients more effectively, further revolutionizing the telehealth landscape.

"""

description_sections.heading: Inspiration
description_sections.content: As members of Penn Labs, a student developer club at the University of Pennsylvania, teaching Git to newcomers is a recurring task for us. This sparked our interest in exploring how emerging technologies like VR/AR can transform educational experiences, particularly in understanding and utilizing current technologies like Git more effectively.

description_sections.heading: What it does
description_sections.content:
Our HackPrinceton track is Education. "Kepler" transcends traditional educational methods by offering an immersive Git metaverse. It enables users to:

Visualize any GitHub repository in Virtual Reality and/or Augmented Reality, making Git learning intuitive and engaging. Navigate and walk through the repository's history, including branches and commits, on iOS devices or on Apple Vision Pro. Access detailed views of commits, including diffs, to learn Git hands-on. Leverage AI to uncover insights, patterns, and key contributors, enhancing understanding of the project's development dynamics. Discover story arcs, bug fixes, team roles, and project objectives in a novel way. Identify suspicious patterns to flag potential integrity issues in hackathons. Allow repository maintainers to analyze contributor trends, fostering a more collaborative open-source development environment. Provide recruiters with deep insights into an applicant's project contributions. Enable applicants to walk recruiters through their project contributions in a more interactive manner. Preserve commit history as an internet artifact, ensuring longevity and accessibility.

description_sections.heading: How we built it
description_sections.content: Our journey in bringing Kepler to life involved a mix of Swift programming, AR/VR technologies, and AI integration, utilizing tools and platforms:

description_sections.heading: Challenges we ran into
description_sections.content:
The Kepler project was a rewarding and enriching journey of learning and adaptation, highlighted by:

The first-time use of Swift and AR/VR technologies by two team members. The first hackathon experience for a member, who also transitioned to using a Mac for the first time this week. Adapting existing software packages for compatibility with visionOS, including forking and modifying the CodeViewer package. Implementing advanced features like topological graph sorting, zoom/collision interactions, and physics in the AR. Bridging the gap between AR and VR, ensuring a seamless experience across platforms.

description_sections.heading: Accomplishments that we're proud of
description_sections.content:
Kepler stands out for both its educational potential and its technical achievements, including:

Successful deployment on both iOS and visionOS, with interactive and engaging user experiences. Integration of diverse features such as AR/VR, AI, and NFT minting into a cohesive educational tool. Implementation of additional interactive elements like particle effects, sound effects, and custom gestures, enriching the user experience.

description_sections.heading: What we learned
description_sections.content: Intricacies of math, coordinates, collisions, and physics in AR environments. Swift programming and AR/VR development, especially for team members new to these areas. Developing for and translating experiences between iOS and visionOS. The challenges and rewards of incorporating a wide range of features and technologies into a single project, facilitated by the support of HackPrinceton's sponsors.

description_sections.heading: What's next for Kepler
description_sections.content:
Looking ahead, we want to improve Kepler's capabilities by:

Integrating AI further to analyze issues, comments, and diffs for even deeper insights into Git repositories. Implementing caching for diffs, database support, and pagination. Adding support for private repository authentication, broadening Kepler's applicability to a wider range of Git projects. -Integration with IDEs to allow developers to access Kepler's insights and visualization capabilities directly within their coding environments, bridging the gap between code writing and version control learning.

winners.tagline: Learnin' Wave: Ignite Your Coding Journey - Customized, Competitive, and Celebrated.

description_sections.heading: Inspiration
description_sections.content: The inspiration behind Learnin' Wave sprang from a desire to bridge the gap between traditional learning and the evolving needs of the digital age. Observing the widespread enthusiasm for coding but a lack of engaging, flexible, and comprehensive platforms, we set out to create a solution that not only makes learning coding accessible and personalized but also fun and socially engaging. The vision was to cultivate a vibrant community of learners who could grow together, challenge each other, and celebrate their achievements in a dynamic, interactive environment. We believe that by making learning an enjoyable and social experience, we can inspire more individuals to embark on their coding journey with confidence and curiosity.

description_sections.heading: What it does
description_sections.content:
Frontend: Tailwind, MERN Stack

Backend: Javascript, LangChain

API Integration: OpenAI SearchAPI Verbwire API

description_sections.heading: Accomplishments that we're proud of
description_sections.content: We take immense pride in the achievements of Learnin' Wave, particularly in how it has democratized the learning process for aspiring coders worldwide. Our platform's ability to generate personalized learning paths tailored to each user's interests and skill level stands out as a testament to our commitment to educational innovation. The enthusiastic feedback from our community, highlighting the effectiveness of our interactive challenges and social learning features, fuels our passion further. Moreover, witnessing users from diverse backgrounds earn badges and advance their skills, often beyond their initial expectations, is incredibly rewarding. These accomplishments underscore our mission to make coding accessible, enjoyable, and rewarding for everyone, and they motivate us to continue enhancing Learnin' Wave for learners around the globe.

description_sections.heading: What we learned
description_sections.content: Throughout the development of Learnin' Wave, our journey was rich with learning experiences, especially in mastering cutting-edge technologies and frameworks. On the frontend, diving deep into Tailwind and the MERN Stack (MongoDB, Express.js, React, and Node.js) allowed us to create a highly responsive and visually appealing interface that enhances user engagement. In backend development, leveraging JavaScript and exploring the capabilities of LangChain provided us with robust tools for building intelligent, scalable systems. The integration of APIs such as OpenAI for advanced content generation, SearchAPI for expansive resource accessibility, and Verbwire API for seamless communication features, opened new avenues for us to deliver a comprehensive and interactive learning environment. This journey has not only expanded our technical expertise but also sharpened our problem-solving skills, paving the way for us to innovate and adapt in the ever-evolving landscape of educational technology.

description_sections.heading: What's next for Learnin' Wave
description_sections.content: The future of Learnin' Wave is brimming with potential and driven by a commitment to continuous innovation. Our roadmap includes the integration of more advanced AI and machine learning features to further personalize learning experiences and offer even more insightful feedback on user progress. We plan to expand our content library, incorporating a wider array of coding languages and technologies to cater to an even broader audience. Additionally, enhancing the social and gamification elements of the platform is a priority, with the aim of introducing more live competitions, coding events, and community-building features. By focusing on these areas, we aspire to not only solidify Learnin' Wave's position as a leader in tech education but also to create a global community of learners who are empowered to achieve their coding aspirations, regardless of their starting point.

winners.tagline: Seamlessly connecting consumers to suppliers for eco-friendly clothing recycling.

description_sections.heading: Inspiration
description_sections.content: According to TheRoundUp.org " Between 80 and 100 billion new clothing garments are produced globally every year. 87% of the materials and fibers used to make clothing will end up in either incinerators or landfills. Only 20% of discarded textiles are collected. Only 1% of clothes will get recycled into new garments." The alarming rate of landfill waste produced by the fast fashion industry is concerning. The environmental degradation and the fashion industry's significant carbon footprint inspired us to make an effort for change. We discovered a gap between consumer intentions and actions towards sustainability. Fashion brands are trying to become more sustainable by providing discounts to customers for recycling clothes, but we all know how hard it is to physically go to a store to give up on old clothes to earn some discounts in our busy schedules. Inspired to bridge this gap, we set out to create a platform that makes sustainable living accessible and rewarding.

description_sections.heading: What Slo-Fashion does
description_sections.content: Slo-Fashion is designed as a personal wardrobe inventory that encourages and facilitates clothing recycling. Users can easily upload pictures of garments they wish to recycle. Our service takes the hassle out of sustainability by picking up the items directly from the user's location and delivering them to fashion brands committed to sustainability. In return for their contribution, users are rewarded with cryptocurrency, which can be used within our marketplace to purchase outfits from approved sustainable brands. This system not only incentivizes recycling but also promotes the circulation of sustainable garments in the fashion ecosystem.

description_sections.heading: How we built it
description_sections.content: In developing Slo-Fashion, we embraced a modern and responsive technology stack that catered to both frontend and backend needs, creating a strong platform that bridges sustainability and fashion. On the frontend, we utilized React.js for its efficient and flexible approach to building interactive user interfaces, complemented by Tailwind CSS for rapid, utility-first styling directly within our HTML, and Node.js to manage dependencies and run development tools via npm. For the backend, Python's readability and extensive library ecosystem streamlined our logic and data processing tasks, while Auth0 offered a secure and scalable authentication system. MongoDB's NoSQL structure provided the flexibility needed for our diverse data storage requirements, enhancing performance and scalability. Additionally, integrating VerbWire allowed seamless automation of logistics, furthering our mission to make sustainable fashion practices accessible and effortless for users. Together, these technologies facilitated the creation of a secure, scalable, and user-friendly platform, underscoring our commitment to promoting sustainable fashion.

description_sections.heading: Challenges we ran into
description_sections.content: In developing our project, we encountered and overcame several challenges, including navigating CORS restrictions, configuring local and API environments, setting up and managing MongoDB, integrating Auth0 for production, refining the user login experience, and incorporating cryptocurrency transactions via Verbwire. Each hurdle was addressed through a combination of thorough research, leveraging community resources, adapting our configurations for local and production environments, and implementing best practices for security and user experience. These experiences not only helped us solve immediate technical issues but also enriched our understanding and skills across a diverse set of tools and technologies, reinforcing the importance of a meticulous, informed approach to problem-solving in software development.

description_sections.heading: Accomplishments that we're proud of
description_sections.content: We're proud of successfully integrating a broad array of functionalities into our project, leveraging a diverse technology stack that includes React.js, Node.js, Python, MongoDB, Auth0, and Tailwind CSS among others. This achievement not only demonstrates our technical proficiency in working with different platforms, frameworks, and software but also underscores our commitment to crafting a comprehensive user experience. From implementing complex features like secure user authentication, real-time notifications, and seamless third-party service integrations to ensuring a responsive and accessible design, every aspect of our project reflects our dedication to this cause. Moreover, the sustainable impact of our initiative, aimed at promoting environmentally friendly fashion practices, stands out as a testament to our mission beyond mere technological achievement. The collaborative effort and continuous learning that propelled us through challenges have not only strengthened our team but also deepened our resolve to make a meaningful contribution to the tech and fashion industries.

description_sections.heading: What we learned
description_sections.content: Through this project, we gained valuable insights and practical experience in several key areas of web development. We learned how to effectively utilize MongoDB, mastering the nuances of database design. Deploying applications with Next.js taught us about server-side rendering, static site generation, and optimizing our projects for production through Vercel's deployment platform, appreciating the seamless integration between development and deployment. Additionally, tackling CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) issues deepened our understanding of web security principles, enabling us to configure our applications to securely manage resources across different origins. This journey not only enhanced our technical skills but also improved our problem-solving capabilities, preparing us for future challenges in software development.

description_sections.heading: What's next for Slo- Fashion
description_sections.content: Looking ahead, we are excited to evolve Slo-Fashion into a more user-friendly mobile application, expanding our reach and impact. We aim to broaden our marketplace, offering an even wider selection of sustainable shopping options. Our vision for Slo-Fashion is not just to be a platform for recycling clothes but to become a movement that reshapes the fashion industry into a more sustainable and environmentally conscious space.

winners.tagline: Discover financial clarity with WealthWise! Our app helps students understand their real financial status by analyzing spending, savings, and investments with AI-driven advice.

description_sections.heading: Inspiration
description_sections.content: Transform your financial insight with our WealthWise app, specifically designed for students! Ever felt puzzled about your finances, unsure whether you're broke or just temporarily cash-tight due to investments? Our app is your solution!

description_sections.heading: What it does
description_sections.content: WealthWise lets you input your spending and investing amounts, and our AI provides personalized advice based on your credit, spending, and investing scores. It helps you make smart financial decisions and avoid those 'broke but not broke' moments.

description_sections.heading: How we built it
description_sections.content:
Next.js and Next UI : These tools provided the framework and UI components to build a responsive and visually appealing front-end for WealthWise. Next.js offered server-side rendering and static site generation to enhance performance and SEO, while Next UI delivered a comprehensive kit of design elements for a cohesive user interface. Auth0 : This service was integral for implementing robust authentication and authorization processes, ensuring that user data remains secure and access is controlled and monitored. TypeScript : Adopting TypeScript enabled us to leverage strong typing and compile-time checks, reducing runtime errors and improving the maintainability of our codebase. .tech Domain : Choosing a .tech domain highlighted our focus on technology and innovation, providing a relevant and brand-aligned internet presence. Flask : Flask's simplicity and flexibility as a backend framework allowed us to quickly develop and deploy server-side applications, providing the necessary API endpoints for our front-end. ModalAI for ML : The Large Language Model was a critical component, offering personalized financial insights by analyzing user data. It enabled the core functionality that differentiates WealthWise in the market. MongoDB : We used MongoDB for its scalability and flexibility in handling diverse data types, facilitating efficient data storage, retrieval, and management for user profiles and transaction data. VerbWire : In order to ensure the privacy of our users we stored credit card information on the block chain, making sure that those details were securely uploaded.

Together, these technologies formed the backbone of WealthWise, enabling us to deliver a comprehensive, secure, and user-friendly financial insight app tailored for students.

description_sections.heading: Challenges we ran into
description_sections.content: Modal Integration: One of the significant hurdles we encountered was the slow response time of our machine learning model. Optimizing an AI to deliver real-time, personalized financial advice without lag was crucial but challenging, given the complexity and depth of data analysis required. Limited Documentation for Modal: Working with Modal presented its unique set of challenges, primarily due to the limited documentation available, and lack of prior experience with the tool. This required us to experiment and troubleshoot more than usual, which was time-consuming and at times, a test of patience. Design Creation: Developing the user interface designs from scratch was difficult to say the least. Ensuring that the design was not only aesthetically pleasing but also user-friendly and intuitive required multiple iterations and constant feedback integration. Card Hover Animation: Implementing the card hover animation was trickier than anticipated. Achieving the desired visual effect with smooth performance across all devices required meticulous CSS tweaking and testing.

description_sections.heading: Accomplishments that we're proud of
description_sections.content: Mastering Next UI : We successfully harnessed the power of Next UI to create a sleek, intuitive, and responsive user interface. Our ability to leverage this framework allowed us to deliver a professional-quality front-end that stands out in terms of design and user experience. Proficiency in TypeScript : Our team achieved a deep understanding and effective utilization of TypeScript in this project. The adoption of TypeScript significantly improved our code's reliability and maintainability, reducing bugs and enhancing development efficiency. Advanced Implementation in Next.js : We effectively leveraged Next.js to optimize our application for performance and SEO, utilizing its server-side rendering and static generation features to enhance user experience and application speed. LLM with Modal : We're particularly proud of integrating a language learning model (LLM) using Modal, which was a cornerstone in enabling our app to provide intelligent financial insights. Despite the challenges with limited Modal documentation, we successfully implemented this feature, enhancing the app's core functionality. Predictive Analytics : Our team developed a robust system to make accurate predictions based on users' past transactions. Learning to analyze historical data and predict future financial trends was a significant achievement that added substantial value to WealthWise. Fine-Tuning LLM : We didn't just implement an LLM; we fine-tuned it to suit our specific needs in the financial domain. This accomplishment allowed us to provide users with more accurate, contextually relevant advice, setting our application apart from generic financial tools. Utilizing the Blockchain : Securely uploading credit card information into the block chain was something we thought would be a great addition to our project, and actually fulfilling that task was extremely rewarding. The blockchain has amazing security capabilities, and being able to use that in a project of this scale was fundamental towards creating a better finished product.

description_sections.heading: What we learned
description_sections.content: Throughout the development of WealthWise, our team gained invaluable insights and deepened our understanding of how to leverage various technologies in a cohesive manner to build an effective solution. We learned the importance of integrating front-end and back-end technologies seamlessly, ensuring that each component contributes optimally to the user experience and app functionality. The use of TypeScript enhanced our code quality, making our application more robust and maintainable. We also developed a deeper appreciation for data privacy and security, understanding the critical role they play in user trust and regulatory compliance. Additionally, the process honed our skills in machine learning, emphasizing the need for precise models that can deliver personalized financial advice.

description_sections.heading: What's next for WealthWise
description_sections.content: Building on our current foundation, the next steps for WealthWise involve expanding its features and refining its technology stack to offer more comprehensive services. Expanding past the front end we built during the limited time we plan to work on more pages, and improve our design to be more user friendly. We plan to enhance the AI model to provide even more personalized and predictive financial insights, leveraging user feedback and advanced analytics to fine-tune its accuracy. Improving our backend with more robust frameworks and considering microservices architecture for better scalability is also on our roadmap. Furthermore, we aim to integrate additional APIs and services to broaden the app's capabilities in financial tracking and advice. Community engagement and user feedback will play a pivotal role in shaping the future updates and features, ensuring WealthWise continually evolves to meet the needs of its users.

winners.tagline: Comprehensive education platform redefining learning. Experience seamless integration of a chatbot, smart scheduler, and a suite of innovative tools, all crafted to elevate your educational journey.

description_sections.heading: Inspiration
description_sections.content: We were inspired to create NewLeaf because we wanted to provide students with a comprehensive and user-friendly platform that would improve their productivity and learning experience. We discovered that many existing tools focused on a single aspect of student life, such as scheduling or note-taking, but lacked integration and consistency. We aimed to develop a multifunctional solution that combines various tools and functionalities into a single, user-friendly interface, allowing students to manage their academic tasks more effectively.

description_sections.heading: What it does
description_sections.content: NewLeaf is a Flask web application that aims to streamline various aspects of student life. NewLeaf offers an AI chatbot for academic assistance, a smart schedule maker/calendar for task organization, a PDF summarizer for condensing lengthy documents, a computer vision hand-tracking canvas for interactive learning, and much more. The platform acts as a one-stop solution for students, providing a variety of tools to help them along their academic journey.

description_sections.heading: How we built it
description_sections.content: We used Flask, a lightweight and flexible Python web framework, to create the backend infrastructure and handle HTTP requests when developing NewLeaf. We designed the user interface for the frontend using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to ensure a seamless user experience. We also used various APIs and libraries to build the AI chatbot, computer vision features, and other functionalities. Our team worked closely together throughout the development process, leveraging our diverse skill sets to address various aspects of the project.

description_sections.heading: Challenges we ran into
description_sections.content: We faced several challenges while developing NewLeaf, which put our problem-solving abilities and perseverance to the test. Integrating multiple APIs and ensuring seamless communication between application components presented significant technical challenges. Furthermore, optimizing performance and scalability while maintaining a responsive user interface necessitated careful planning and iteration.

description_sections.heading: Accomplishments that we're proud of
description_sections.content: We're proud to have successfully implemented a wide range of features and functionalities within NewLeaf, resulting in a comprehensive solution for students. Our AI chatbot effectively answers academic questions, and the smart schedule maker/calendar helps users stay organized and productive. The use of computer vision hand-tracking technology adds an interactive element to the platform, improving the learning experience. Furthermore, our team's collaborative effort and dedication allowed us to deliver a polished and functional product within the hackathon deadline.

description_sections.heading: What we learned
description_sections.content: We learned a lot about web app development, API integration, and project management while working on NewLeaf. We learned how to use Flask for backend development while implementing front-end features in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Working with different APIs taught us about data integration, error handling, and best API practices. We also improved our communication and teamwork skills by working together to solve problems and make decisions.

description_sections.heading: What's next for NewLeaf
description_sections.content:
In the future, we plan to expand NewLeaf's features and capabilities to increase its utility for students. This includes fine-tuning the AI chatbot to provide more personalized and comprehensive assistance, incorporating new machine learning algorithms for advanced functionality, and improving the user interface for a more intuitive experience. We also talked about many ways to combine the tasks we divided among ourselves.

winners.tagline: Experience Enlightin AI, where AI tutors personalize your study, generate quizzes from notes, and pre-grade assignments. A seamless LMS adventure with smart, instant academic support.

description_sections.heading: Inspiration
description_sections.content: The quest for a truly effective Learning Management System (LMS) is rooted in the collective struggle of learners across the globe. Traditional systems often fall short in engaging the student's curiosity and enabling a deeper understanding of subjects. This is especially true for international students adapting to educational landscapes abroad. We envisioned an LMS that not only organizes learning resources but also actively contributes to the learning process. Thus, Enlightin AI was born - merging the structured world of LMS with the dynamic capabilities of AI to create a more intuitive and responsive educational experience.

description_sections.heading: What it does
description_sections.content: Enlightin AI redefines the LMS space by embedding AI at its core. Our system is a full-fledged LMS enhanced by an AI tutor that provides instant responses to all academic queries, including personalized advice. The AI-powered quiz generator transforms notes into interactive quizzes, facilitating self-paced learning. Beyond this, our feedback feature utilizes AI to offer constructive feedback on student submissions, providing an opportunity for improvement before final evaluations. This harmonious blend of AI with a comprehensive LMS framework is designed to optimize educational outcomes.

description_sections.heading: How we built it
description_sections.content: Crafted with precision, our platform is built upon the robust Python-Django framework, while the front end dazzles with a fusion of CSS, Bootstrap, HTML, JS, and the React framework. We harnessed the power of PyMuPDF and SQLite for backend operations, enriched by the OpenAI API's intelligent insights. Our developmental toolkit included an array of technologies such as NLP, GitHub, and Npm, shaping a seamless and responsive educational ecosystem.

description_sections.heading: Challenges we ran into
description_sections.content: Our initial challenge was sculpting the multi-layered backend infrastructure, ensuring seamless navigation between the admin and student interfaces. The complexity was daunting, leading to many debugging sessions. However, we tackled this by prototyping and iterating our designs. Implementing AI for meaningful feedback on student work was another hurdle, but with PyMuPDF and OpenAI API, we devised a system that analyzes submissions and generates nuanced feedback coupled with preliminary scoring.

description_sections.heading: Accomplishments that we're proud of
description_sections.content: Our crowning achievement is the successful integration of an LMS with vital AI features. Creating an operational, feature-rich LMS was a monumental task, but seeing it function with AI capabilities is our pride. The AI quiz generator, the Enlightin AI tutor, and the feedback system stand as testaments to our innovative approach.

description_sections.heading: What we learned
description_sections.content: This journey has been a trove of learning, from exploring advanced Django features and Python libraries to honing our front-end design with Bootstrap. We delved into NLP and discovered the importance of meticulous planning in software development, ensuring every feature aligns with our vision.

description_sections.heading: What's next for Enlightin AI
description_sections.content: Enlightin AI's trajectory is set towards incorporating a social-media-like platform for scholarly discourse, a moderated space for sharing academic opportunities. We envision a future where expansive AI models are trained on comprehensive course content, further refining the capabilities of our AI tutor. Our roadmap includes enhancing the dashboard for a more personalized learning experience, integrating unique notes, quizzes, and assignments for each course, thereby elevating Enlightin AI to new heights of educational innovation.

winners.tagline: To make CS more accessible, we created a groundbreaking LLM framework that used paradigm based task planning to assist students who verbally communicating to our AI which we gave a body.

prizes.prize_name: Best Use of AI in Education

description_sections.heading: Inspiration
description_sections.content: Growing up in rural Alabama, David had little access to coding mentorship. Our team shared the the drive to make coding more accessible sparking the creation of Project Lyla, a personal tutor

description_sections.heading: What we do
description_sections.content: Lyla is an AI computer science tutor built using agent swarms and retrieval augmentation generation. To make collaboration as easy as possible we gave Lyla a physical form. Users will have the option to verbally communicate with Lyla to help break down any technical problems they encounter without actually solving the problem for our users. Unlike many other LLMs, Lyla focuses on building user understanding of solutions by walking them through it step by step without giving a direct answer. Our MVP focuses on data structures and algorithms, and we plan to expand to encompass more technical domains.

winners.tagline: An AI driven solution that takes user's medical bills as input and checks against a national database to check whether they have been overcharged for any services and assists them in filing complaints

prizes.prize_name: Best Financial Hack by Capital One

description_sections.heading: Inspiration
description_sections.content: The inspiration for our web app stemmed from the widespread frustration and confusion surrounding medical billing practices. Countless individuals have encountered situations where they receive medical bills that seem exorbitant or include charges for services they never received or were inaccurately billed. Such experiences often leave patients feeling helpless, as navigating the complex world of healthcare billing can be overwhelming and intimidating. We were moved by stories of individuals facing financial strain due to inflated medical bills, and we were determined to create a solution that empowers patients to advocate for themselves and challenge unfair billing practices. Our motivation comes from the belief that everyone deserves access to transparent and fair healthcare pricing, and our web app serves as a tool to level the playing field and ensure that patients are not exploited by unjust billing practices. Through our platform, we aspire to bring about positive change in the healthcare industry by promoting accountability, transparency, and consumer advocacy.

description_sections.heading: What it does
description_sections.content:
Recognizing the complexity of medical billing and the prevalence of errors and inflated charges, our platform utilizes advanced algorithms to compare itemized bills against industry standards and regional averages. Through a user-friendly interface, individuals can effortlessly upload their medical bills and receive instant feedback on discrepancies. Additionally, our platform guides users through the steps of filing complaints with relevant authorities or negotiating with healthcare providers for fairer pricing. We enhance user convenience and accessibility by integrating a Talkbot feature, which accepts user speech as input and generates AI-generated speech as output. This innovative approach streamlines the process even further, allowing users to interact with the platform naturally and receive guidance in real-time conversation. By demystifying medical billing and advocating for consumer rights through both advanced algorithms and user-friendly talkbot interactions, our web app endeavors to alleviate financial burdens and promote accountability within the healthcare system.

In addition to assisting users with their medical bills and complaints, our Talkbot serves as a versatile educational tool, offering insights into various aspects of healthcare and billing practices. Users can leverage the Talkbot to learn more about fraudulent billing schemes, understand data privacy and security measures, and delve into a wide array of healthcare-related topics. Whether it's understanding common billing errors, recognizing signs of fraudulent activity, or gaining knowledge about protecting personal health information, the Talkbot provides valuable information in an interactive and engaging manner. By offering educational resources and fostering awareness about consumer rights and healthcare best practices, our platform not only addresses immediate billing concerns but also empowers users with the knowledge needed to navigate the healthcare landscape confidently. Through the dual functionality of assistance and education, our web app strives to promote financial well-being, privacy awareness, and accountability within the healthcare system.

description_sections.heading: How we built it
description_sections.content: We built it using a multitude of technologies to implement the entire functionality. We used google's cloud vision api to run OCR on the bills of the users to extract information about procedures and their costs. These prices are then compared to prices in the hospital price transparency database released under the Hospital Price Transparency act of the US government. We are filtering the results in the database based on the user's insurance provider to get the accurate average national cost for each service. We are then using react.js to build an easy to use web app that gives the user all of this information in an easy to understand format. We then also provide all this information as context to gemini pro so that we can implement a bot that can further guide the user as to how they can file a complaint for the overcharge. Additionally, we are using faster-whisper and TTS models for speech to text and text to speech functionality to implement an efficient, almost real time talk bot. We also use 0Auth to validate users and store their data, including previous bills and other personal data such as address in MongoDB which is also passed as context to the LLM.

description_sections.heading: Challenges we ran into
description_sections.content: Integrating all the different models into one smooth pipeline was a major challenge. Additionally connecting the frontend to the backend for the talk bot, and ensuring multiple data files were transferred successfully was a major challenge.

description_sections.heading: Accomplishments that we're proud of
description_sections.content: We are really proud of the fact that we are quickly able to identify all the procedures the user underwent and are able to determine efficiently whether they have been overcharged against the national average for their particular insurance provider.

description_sections.heading: What we learned
description_sections.content: Throughout the development process, we gained valuable insights into the complexities of medical billing, the intricacies of integrating various technologies, and the importance of user-centric design. We learned how to effectively leverage cloud services like Google Cloud Vision API and Hospital Price Transparency databases to extract and compare billing data. Additionally, we honed our skills in frontend development with React.js and backend integration for seamless user experiences. The challenges we encountered provided opportunities for learning and growth, ultimately strengthening our understanding of healthcare systems and technological solutions.

description_sections.heading: What's next for Feasco
description_sections.content: Moving forward, we envision expanding Faircharge to offer even more comprehensive support and resources for healthcare consumers. We plan to enhance our Talkbot feature to provide personalized guidance tailored to each user's specific circumstances, including assistance with insurance claims, appeals, and negotiating medical bills. Furthermore, we aim to incorporate machine learning techniques to continuously improve accuracy in detecting overcharges and identifying potential billing errors. Additionally, we aspire to collaborate with healthcare organizations and advocacy groups to raise awareness about medical billing transparency and consumer rights. Ultimately, our goal is to empower individuals to take control of their healthcare finances and advocate for fair and equitable treatment within the healthcare system.
